Nancy Odindo, a journalist at TUKO.co.ke, brings over four years of experience covering politics, news, and feature stories across digital and print media in Kenya.
Bomet - An elderly woman was burned at the Bethel of Jesus Ministry International in Kapkwen after being accused of practicing witchcraft.
What happened inside Kapkwen church in Bomets?
The shocking incident, which took place within the church compound, has sparked public outrage, with calls for the arrest of the church leaders and the closure of the institution.
According to witnesses, the woman was brought to the church with alleged magical items, including snakes, frogs, and traditional medicine.
According to video footage shared by Citizen TV, during a prayer session, she reportedly collapsed as congregants attempted to rid her of her supposed demonic possessions. Church members then carried her outside and set a fire, claiming to be burning her alleged witchcraft items.
â€œShe came with her witchcraft items, such as snakes, frogs, and drugs. When she tried to remove those things, she fell. The pastor helped her, and we decided to take her outside and burn them. Anyone who brings such items, we burn them. We cannot allow them to take them back after being delivered,â€ a church member stated.
The woman reportedly screamed in different voices as she was carried over the fire, which worshippers interpreted as her demons being cast out.
Inside the church, several women were seen lying on the floor, engaged in intense prayer.
The incident has ignited public condemnation, with many Kenyans calling for immediate action against the church leadership. Some have demanded stricter regulations to curb criminal activities in religious institutions.
The case has also raised concerns about the rise of extreme religious practices and the exploitation of vulnerable individuals under the guise of deliverance prayers.
